embeds.title: Impeccable Pecs
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you gain **Strength** :p_strength:, gain an equal amount of Temporary :p_temp:_HP.
Start each combat with 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
*Glorious.*

messages.content: and upgraded ig
:watcherthink:
This card is so much fun in the late game
Free scaling every turn, and lots of combo potential
Junk in short hallway fights, but those should be half over by the time temp strength wears off anyways
It does have to compete with makeshift armor but that's only a real substitute when upgraded
Only problem is if you have both, the temp str still eats your artifact stacks

this is like the one good mad gremlin centered card. Its hard to take though, 3 energy for a slow power on a character that is often wining fights in 2 turns. But its fine to have bad cards in a gremlins deck because your always taking raid every time its offered and that card requires 2 or 3 discards to be played; so your free to have some bad cards as you can discard them. Still though you don't want so many situational cards and this is very much a power thats only working in boss fights. The main card you would use this with is flex+; giving 4 strength for 0 cost on a common makes it pretty easy to play at least one of them a turn. If you can play flex every turn, or multiple (which is pretty realistic). This card can scale really high, basically being a stronger demon form. Theres also erupt, another rare that gives 5/7 strength with this and mad gremlin himself giving strength when attacked.
Gremlins having a card that can realistically generate 8+ strength a turn and its just okay, I think is a pretty good showcase of the character's power level as a whole.
Demon Form wishes it was this good
like, if this puts out "only" as much strength as Demon Form+ you're doing something wrong.
and gremlins are even better at using strength than ironclad
Only thing they don't have is limit break
hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
<Rage Break> says hello

messages.content: mad is more like somewhat more strength due to the inconsistency to me ngl
admittedly, Ironclad's Flex is a bit harder to use than Gremlins' Flex

As has been noted, this is largely a boss fight scaling damage solution, and tends to be a curse in most other fights barring giant head and other longer hallway/elite fights. Gremlins are naturally very good at short hallway fights due to their powerful front loaded burst damage, so it's usually fine to carry around a couple of cards like this, you don't get punished that hard for it. It's output is pretty variable, since some enemies like byrds, book of stabbing, or most bosses can trigger mad gremlin multiple times in a turn, whereas others like giant head and transient only do large single hit attacks. In most of the really difficult/important fights, mad gremlin gets opportunities to proc it's ability several times per turn.

Now the real issue with unforgiving in my opinion is that there aren't many other reasons to focus on mad gremlin, and it's a rare, so by the time it's offered to you, you are probably already focused on scaling with a different gremlin. Shield, fat, and wizard all have very strong and very clear scaling packages that are better supported, and available at lower rarities, so it's pretty unusual to be able to find room for unforgiving. It's also very expensive, and fairly slow, when other powers like target wounds do the job in a much faster and cheaper way. You can also sometimes have strong enough burst damage on gremlins that you don't even really need scaling damage barring neow, which is another strike against unforgiving.

It's really bad against all of the act 1 elites, though it can do work against act 1 bosses. Solid into act 2 elites and hallways, assuming you can safely get it in play. Great with flex, which does tend to be pretty takeable on gremlins since they are so good at dealing burst damage and spamming attacks. The upgrade is pretty mandatory, otherwise you are likely taking significant damage to play this. Bolster rod and mummified hand also both help mitigate the cost.

I don't think that unforgiving really needs a buff, it's just that mad gremlin as a whole feels much less supported, and much less powerful than the other gremlins, and so you rarely go down that path of synergies. I would hesitate to suggest buffing the mad gremlin synergies, in reality it's much more prudent to nerf the consistency and power of the rest of gremlins synergies. It says a lot that a card that can often be made into better/cheaper demon form with the right synergies feels totally unnecessary to use on gremlins because they have so many easier ways to deal enough damage throughout the run.
